Description: Terracotta loom-weight of pyramidal shape, pierced at the top, chipped in places. Red-brown micaceous (Nile silt or East Greek clay?) fabric with many small quartz inclusions and a sandstone-like structure.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by McLean Museum and Art Gallery, Greenock. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Old label records excavation year as 1885.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TF.04)
